title: Somewhere between Serpentine Sans Oblique and Muscle Italic
content:
So I'm looking for a chunky, slightly modernist italic font but haven't really found what I'm looking for.

I'm aiming somewhere between [Serpentine Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224500/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/serpentine-sans/bold-oblique/) which carries a certain unwanted 70s car chase movie vibe and [Muscle](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224500/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/muscle/) which is just not quite legible enough. I'm mostly concerned with the digits and the uppercase alphabet for captions.

Suggestions?
author: Stackhaus23

comments.content: For an appetizer: See the [Extra/Ultra Bold list](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224500/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/extra-bold-ultra-black-fonts/) from Stephen Coles.
… and this thread: [Cool alternatives to Serpentine Bold Oblique for a Racing Poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224500/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36859)

not to be mercenary, but scroll down and look at Slag....

[Racepak 1B](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224500/http:/www.thefontry.com/racepak1b)

or Earth A.D. Spurred...  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry/earth-a-d/spurred/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014224500/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry/earth-a-d/spurred/)

but maybe not...

~~~~~~~~~~~~~
